content: sunshine scrubby it s a dish scrubby it s a bath scrubby it s two scrubbies in one suggested materials worsted weight cotton yarn polyester scrubby yarn size g 4 mm crochet hook stitch markers optional large-eye needle for weaving in ends abbreviations used slip_stitch = slip_stitch does not count as a stitch and is not included in stitch count chain = chain stitch double_crochet = double_crochet stitch skip = skip note initial ch2 does not count as a stitch throughout pattern beginning with the scrubby yarn and leaving about a 3 inch tail - base chain 4 join with slip_stitch to first chain circle made ok to substitute magic_ring if you prefer them r1 chain 2 12 double_crochet in circle join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet 12 r2 chain 2 starting in same double_crochet work 2 dcs into each double_crochet around join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet 24 r3 chain 2 starting in same double_crochet work 1 double_crochet then 2 dcs in next double_crochet around join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet 36 fasten_off and work the tail under a few stitches in back to hide it using the cotton yarn and leaving about a 3 inch tail - base chain 4 join with slip_stitch to first chain circle made ok to substitute magic_ring if you prefer them r1 chain 2 12 double_crochet in circle join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet 12 r2 chain 2 starting in same double_crochet work 2 dcs into each double_crochet around join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet 24 r3 chain 2 starting in same double_crochet work 1 double_crochet then 2 dcs in next double_crochet around join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet 36 do not fasten_off © marsha glassner 2022 with wrong sides together firmly knot the beginning tails to join both circles holding the two circles together turn so the scrubby side faces you as you work r4 hide the beginning tails of both circles and the ending tail of the scrubby circle in the middle r4 chain 2 working through the r3 loops of both circles starting in same double_crochet work 1 double_crochet in next 2 double_crochet then 2 dcs in next double_crochet around join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet 48 r5 skip 2 double_crochet work 7 double_crochet in the next double_crochet around skip 2 double_crochet join with slip_stitch in the join slip_stitch from r4 fasten_off and weave in the end many thanks for testing to shelia polito and sue perb taney © marsha glassner 2022
